intro: Prototulbaghia, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and white. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and aromatic, often emitting a strong scent when crushed. Prototulbaghia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
